Description: 7 beads in different sizes and material. A: One ovoid cylindrical bead made of faience, white. B: One ring-shaped bead made of a paste-like material, in a greyish-white colour. C: Two cylindrical segmented beads with each four segments, one made of white faience, broken off, one made of turquoise faience, intact. D: Two disc-shaped beads, one made of ostrich eggshell, the other made of faience, white. E: One elongated spherical bead made of carnelian, slightly translucent, one edge is either unfinished or broken off.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), D16.K, Mound β, level 1
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
